channel.title: Utah on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Utah on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Stating The Seemingly Obvious
item.description: [big]Utah is a great state, but with its historic ties to the Mormon religion (and that religion’s hard-to-ignore political clout), it occasionally runs into some head-scratching situations—especially when it comes to alcohol.[/big] The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints prohibits its members from consuming alcohol, and that has informed the state’s laws on the issue over the years. Beer is sold at bars and some restaurants, but at an alcohol level that barely even counts.
